intro: Schmaltzia lasiocarpa, commonly known as the wooly Schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive, slightly serrated edge. Schmaltzia lasiocarpa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
